titleStmt.title: Board of Trustees of Transylvania University

availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

org.orgName: Board of Trustees of Transylvania University

body.p: Governing body of Transylvania University. Established by the general assembly of the Commonwealth of Virginia with thirteen appointed trustees in what became Boyle County, Kentucky, in 1780. First meeting with Chairman David Rice and 24 other trustees in 1783. Relocated to Lexington, Kentucky, in 1789. The board of trustees agreed to convey all property and funds to Kentucky University on the merger of the two universities, and the board of trustees were dissolved following Transylvania University's discontinuation on June 9, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Irvin E. Lunger, "Transylvania College: Its History and Future," The Register of the Kentucky Historical Society, Vol. 56, No. 4, 309-318.
John D. Wright, Jr. and Eric H. Christianson, "Transylvania University " in The Kentucky Encyclopedia, John E. Kleber, ed. (Lexington: University Press of Kentucky, 1992), 894-96.
"Our History," Transylvania University, http://www.transy.edu/about/our-history, (c) 2003-2016 by Transylvania University (accessed January 2, 2020).
